issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.summary: UI hangs when attempting to allocate IP with insufficient privs

comments.body: I'm logged in and it looks like the browser is waiting for a response from the proxy. Could be CLC is not replying properly, will check.

I think I need to pass this back to the CLC team at this point [~sjones]. The user console in 3.4 eventually gets an error back from the CLC, but it takes about 28 seconds. {noformat} 2013-10-16 17:25:38,608 clc [ERROR]:AllocateAddressTypecouldn't allocate Seems OK with a recent build from testing:

{code}
# euare-accountcreate -a sjones
sjones	474116343212
# euare-usercreate --as-account sjones -u sjones
# euare-useruploadpolicy --as-account sjones -u sjones -p slowalloc -o '{
> "Version":"allow_basic.20131004",
> "Statement":[
> { "Sid":"1", "Effect":"Allow", "Action":[ "ec2:AssociateAddress", "ec2:AttachVolume", "ec2:Authorize*", "ec2:CreateKeyPair", "ec2:CreateSecurityGroup", "ec2:CreateTags", "ec2:CreateVolume", "ec2:DeleteKeyPair", "ec2:DeleteSecurityGroup", "ec2:DeleteTags", "ec2:DeleteVolume", "ec2:Describe*", "ec2:DetachVolume", "ec2:DisassociateAddress", "ec2:GetConsoleOutput", "ec2:GetPassword*", "ec2:ReleaseAddress", "ec2:RunInstances", "ec2:TerminateInstances", ], "Resource":"*" }
> ]
> }'
# euare-useraddkey --as-account sjones -u sjones
AKILIOU7HGK54HMWGUP3
08QYLaFozBj89R022zB5hXc3YubMpVVzDSgF3Dnt
# time euca-allocate-address -I AKILIOU7HGK54HMWGUP3 -S 08QYLaFozBj89R022zB5hXc3YubMpVVzDSgF3Dnt
euca-allocate-address: error (AllocateAddressType): couldn't allocate addresses

real	0m0.779s
user	0m0.157s
sys	0m0.022s 
{code}
I was testing on a server built 2013-10-03 07:55:08, but I'll fire up another now to test this against.
I just tested this with a current build of the console and back-end and can confirm response time is fast. The user is not left hanging.
Marking as resolved since it's no longer reproducible. Please reopen if it is seen again.
